summary.p: The Nrrd Field Converter creates a SCIRun mesh and field from Nrrd data. It makes assumptions about the field and mesh type based on the input data. The mesh data must be properly attributed with SCIRun properties for the mesh to be created.

description.p: The Nrrd Field Converter creates a SCIRun mesh and field from the data. It makes assumptions about the field and mesh type based on the input data.
For a mesh to be created each point component(s) must contain the following properties:
If the Topology is Structured a geometry property is also needed:
If the data is Unstructured a connectivity list is needed with the follow properties:
Cell Type - { Tetahedron, Pyramid, Prism, Hexahedron, Triangle,Quadrilateral, Curve, Point }
For a structured mesh, the points may be given as either components or as an n dimensional array by 2, or 3.
If no mesh is present and the user has selected the "No Mesh" option a regular mesh from 0 to 1 will be created.

Field data is not requied, but if present, it need not have any properties and can not have a property "Topology" which is reserved only for mesh data. Further it may be sent as either scalar, vector, or tensor or as individual components. If sent as components there must be either 1, 3, or 6 inputs and each must be scalar.
For all inputs the Nrrd data may be send individually or along a multiple tuple axis. Sending along multiple tuple axis redeuces the number connections needed between modules.
